repositories.name: user-service
repositories.description: Microservice for user authentication and management

repositories.name: payment-gateway
repositories.description: Payment processing service with support for multiple providers

pullRequests.title: Add OAuth2 integration
pullRequests.body:
This PR adds OAuth2 integration with Google and GitHub providers. It includes new API endpoints for authentication flow and updates to the user model to store OAuth tokens.

Related to #28 and fixes #15.

pullRequests.title: Update user profile endpoints
pullRequests.body: Refactors the user profile API endpoints to support the new OAuth providers. Adds missing fields and validation for profile updates.

pullRequests.title: Add Stripe payment processor
pullRequests.body: Implements Stripe as a payment processor option with support for credit cards, ACH, and international payments. Includes webhook handling for payment events.

issues.title: Implement OAuth2 authentication
issues.body:
We need to implement OAuth2 authentication to support Google and GitHub login. This should include:

- OAuth2 client setup
- Login flow
- Token storage
- User profile syncing

issues.title: User profile doesn't show OAuth linked accounts
issues.body: Currently when a user links their account with OAuth providers, this information isn't displayed in their profile settings.

issues.title: Add support for multiple payment providers
issues.body:
We need to support multiple payment providers including:

- Stripe
- PayPal
- Square

Each provider should have a consistent interface.

slackMessages.text: I just opened PR #42 to add OAuth integration: https://github.com/acme/user-service/pull/42
Nice, that will fix the issue with the missing OAuth providers. Have you tested with both Google and GitHub?
Yes, I've tested with both providers. The Google flow is working great, but GitHub is returning some extra profile fields we should probably store.
@taylor-eng I'm working on the OAuth PR (#42). Could you look at my approach for storing the tokens? Not sure if we should encrypt them or just hash them.
We should definitely encrypt them, not just hash. I'll add some comments to the PR.
Heads up team, PR #43 is ready for review. It builds on the OAuth work @sarah-dev is doing in PR #42.
Great! This should also address issue #28 about showing linked accounts in the profile.
Just merged PR #67 adding Stripe integration to the payment gateway. You can now process credit card payments.
Awesome! This is the first step in addressing issue #54 for supporting multiple payment providers.
Next we should work on PayPal integration. I can start on that next week.
